javadoc:
Objects that implement Undoable have the ability to "remember" some number
 of stable states that are created as operations are performed upon them.  The
 object then provides methods for "undoing" to a previous state or "redoing" to
 a later state.

methods.javadoc: Returns true if there is a previous state to "undo" to.
methods.name: canUndo
methods.comment: Returns true if there is a previous state to "undo" to.

methods.javadoc: Returns true if there is a later state to "redo" to.
methods.name: canRedo
methods.comment: Returns true if there is a later state to "redo" to.

methods.javadoc:
Returns to the previous state.  Normally, this will cause the current state
 to appear on the "redo" stack.  This method will do nothing if there are
 no previous states to "undo".
@throws IOException if an IO error occurs
methods.name: undo
methods.comment:
Returns to the previous state.  Normally, this will cause the current state
 to appear on the "redo" stack.  This method will do nothing if there are
 no previous states to "undo".

methods.javadoc:
Returns to a latter state that exists because of an undo.  Normally, this
 will cause the current state to appear on the "undo" stack.  This method
 will do nothing if there are no latter states to "redo".
@throws IOException if an IO error occurs
methods.name: redo
methods.comment:
Returns to a latter state that exists because of an undo.  Normally, this
 will cause the current state to appear on the "undo" stack.  This method
 will do nothing if there are no latter states to "redo".

methods.javadoc: Returns a description of the chanage that would be "undone".
methods.name: getUndoName
methods.comment: Returns a description of the chanage that would be "undone".

methods.javadoc: Returns a description of the change that would be "redone".
methods.name: getRedoName
methods.comment: Returns a description of the change that would be "redone".

methods.javadoc:
Adds the given transaction listener to this domain object
@param listener the new transaction listener to add
methods.name: addTransactionListener
methods.comment: Adds the given transaction listener to this domain object

params.name: listener
params.comment: the new transaction listener to add

methods.javadoc:
Removes the given transaction listener from this domain object.
@param listener the transaction listener to remove
methods.name: removeTransactionListener
methods.comment: Removes the given transaction listener from this domain object.

name: Undoable
comment:
Objects that implement Undoable have the ability to "remember" some number
 of stable states that are created as operations are performed upon them.  The
 object then provides methods for "undoing" to a previous state or "redoing" to
 a later state.
